content:
The Hausdorff Center for Mathematics at the University of Bonn is looking for multiple PhD positions and postdocs, to start between April and October 2026.

  • The PhD positions are for 3 years, and the application deadline is the 15th of November. More information here: https://www.mathjobs.org/jobs/list/27038
  • The postdocs are for 2+1 years, and the application deadline is the 31st of October. More information here: https://www.mathjobs.org/jobs/list/27036

These are department-wide positions, and when applying you should state that you want to be mentored by me (in the research area IRU2: Formalized mathematics and computer-assisted proofs).
If you have any questions, the website of the Hausdorff School has more information for PhD students and postdocs: https://www.mathematics.uni-bonn.de/hsm-school . Of course, feel free to reach out to me with any questions.

Reminder about the positions above! If you were considering to apply, but haven't yet, please do apply!

There is also an update: the formalization group (led by me) can hire multiple people to join our group. Unfortunately, I cannot share the precise details yet. This is in addition to the department-wide positions. When applying, you're automatically applying to both options.
Note: for PhD students there will be another application round in March--April, which would still allow you to start in Fall 2026 (this option likely doesn't exist for postdocs).
